title: 'She has risen': Gwendoline Christie compared to the Pope on the red carpet
text:
Gwendoline Christie's "Game of Thrones" character Brienne may not have landed on the Iron Throne – but on the Emmys carpet Sunday night, Twitter bowed down to her showstopping gown.

Many users compared Christie, who is nominated for the first time for best supporting actress in a drama series, to religious figures. She wore a Gucci cruise 2020 cream, satin long sleeve boat neck gown – including lion head metal medallions. It looked like something people might have worn in ancient Rome, and Twitter was quick to notice.

Best dressed at the Emmys: Emilia Clarke, Regina King were flawless

"Gwendoline Christie ain't dressed as jesus? SHE IS JESUS," one user wrote. Another posted, "Gwendoline Christie is the pope now, sorry I don't make the rules."

"The g in gwendoline stands for God," one user suggested.

Gwendoline Christie ain't dressed as jesus? SHE IS JESUS #Emmys — Hania (@azirastiel) September 22, 2019

"Only miss Gwendoline can pull this dress off," one user wrote.

Some simply referred to her as a queen.

"The only Queen you will be bending your knees for today. Gwendoline Christie NEVER DISAPPOINTS! Looking everything regal in Gucci," one Twitter user wrote.

The worst-dressed stars at the Emmys: Kendall Jenner, Lena Headey, Karamo Brown, more

Others pointed out that she was wearing the colors of one of the prominent families, the Lannisters, in the hit HBO series.

The only Queen you will be bending your knees for today. Gwendoline Christie NEVER DISAPPOINTS! Looking everything regal in Gucci at the #Emmys. #Emmys2019 pic.twitter.com/JbPB1PFVP7 — Rashmi Nayak (@rashnayak) September 22, 2019

Not everyone fawned over the look, however.

"I cannot GET OVER Gwendoline Christie in A Roman toga! Why, Gwendoline, WHY???" one user wrote.

"Another one of my favorite awards show people is Gwendoline Christie. ... Just not my favorite look from her at all," another concurred.

Christie submitted herself for Emmys contention this year after HBO didn't.

"I submitted myself because I wanted it to be a testament to the character and everything that the character Brienne represents ... she's outside of patriarchal constraints and she has a voice that is considered marginalized" Christie said on the Fox red carpet.

Who won?: Emmys 2019 full winners list

Our take on Emmys 2019: A shocking 'Fleabag' sweep, and still love for 'Game of Thrones'

This article originally appeared on USA TODAY: Emmys 2019: Gwendoline Christie of 'Game of Thrones' called Jesus
description: Twitter bowed down to Gwendoline Christie's showstopping Emmys gown.
